text:
Very good, and very easy.  The first time I was a bit nervous about the meat ending up dry, so I made it using a total of about 3 lbs of chicken and dumped in about  20 oz of Franks buffalo sauce.  This resulted in a soupy, spicy-ish mix, which, while still delicious, was too wet.  The second time, I put in 5 lbs of chicken and about 12 oz of sauce.  Delish, but a bit short on spice/flavor.  I think the next time I make it, I'll aim for the middle - about 4 lbs of chicken and about 16 oz of sauce.  Also, to make it a bit healthier, I cut out the butter entirely both times...

text:
This was a great Super Bowl dinner.  Very easy and very delicious!  I used more chicken (about 4 breasts and 3 boneless thighs) and less of the wing sauce (12 ounce bottle).  My sauce did not evaporate and the chicken did not dry out.  Also, as someone else suggested, I made my own ranch seasoning (recipe from this site) because the prepackaged kind had way too much salt and other chemicals that I don't like to use.  We used onion rolls (personal preference).  We served this with cole slaw and blue cheese on the side.  Will definitely make this again.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I'm sure that it would be five stars just as written but I did change it a little. I used more chicken and a whole 12 oz bottle of Frank's wing sauce.I couldn't find ranch dressing mix that doesn't have msg, so I just sprinkled seasonings on top of the chicken (tarragon, lots of garlic powder, parsley, a little dill, dried onions) Then I poured the wing sauce over and cooked until the chicken could shred and added about 3tbs of unsalted butter at that point. after shredding we put it on toasted buttered French rolls and added shredded lettuce, blue cheese and drizzled with homemade buttermilk ranch dressing. It was very easy and tasted amazing. I will definitely make it again. I served purple coleslaw with it.

Amazing!!! So easy and tasty.
I had to make a few changes while cooking. My crockpot doesn't have a 6 hour low setting (and I was running short on time) so I set it to 6 hours on high and took it out after 3.5 hours. It was perfect! I used 2 lbs of chicken and a bottle of Frank's Red Hot Buffalo wing sauce, and a packet Hidden Valley Ranch.
I've been make buffalo chicken wraps for lunch all week! Yum!

text:
I am a  lifelong  spicy hot wing  lover all my life and  when I tried this the first time , it was ok but not to my particular  full hot chicken wing  liking  but knew it  had potential to be perfect,  so  when I made it a couple weeks later  I made It  a bit better , I  melted the butter, and poured it and all the other ingredients in a bowl, then added  1 tablespoon of vinegar and 4 drops of Dave's Insanity Sauce,. and mixed well, then poured it over  the  Chicken and  and then I let sit for 1/2  hours  to marinate .. and  when I had some ..it was as if I was in ecstasy.. Had it all, mouth watering  Flavor, perfect amount of heat & texture  perfect all the way around

I think the original was great. I made it twice, it was excellent. The third time I made it I modified it a little. Instead of using packaged ranch I used a bottle of liquid ranch. Then I seasoned it with old bay, splash of Italian dressing and two heaping TBLS of garlic. I put a half stick of butter and used franks extra hot sauce. Slow cooked it 8 hrs.  Then shredded it. I let it sit for about an hour on warm. IT was delicious!!!!!

city:

None
country:
None
text:
This was just ok. I only put 1/2 bottle of sauce in the crockpot because I was afraid it was going to be too much liquid, and it was still very soupy when it was done cooking. So I shredded the meat in the sauce and mixed it up then put it on a burner on medium-high to cook off some of the liquid. It was very moist, not dry at all which was good. I melted pepper jack cheese on the rolls, added the chicken, and topped it off with a splash of wing sauce. My husband said it just tasted like something that was hot to be hot, there wasn't a lot of flavor. I liked it a little better than he did, but I had blue cheese dressing on mine which cut the spiciness a bit and added some more flavor. If I try this again, I will cook the chicken with the ranch dressing first, then remove it from the liquid in the pot, shred it and add the sauce and butter. I might try adding adding some cream cheese as others suggested to cut the heat.

text:
I cooked it in a crock pot for 4.5 hours (6 breasts, 1 whole packet of Italian dressing and Frank's Original hot sauce).  After 4.5, I shredded it and added 6-7 tbsp. of butter so that it was more like real, NY style wing sauce.  I let the shredded chicken sit in the sauce on warm for a few hours before serving it.  We ate it again the next day and it was even better.  I don't even think it needs to be on a roll, but I served it with shredded cheese and small rolls.

Display Name:
Christina Ball Mangini

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1549214.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was a good, quick, help yourself when you're hungry kinda dinner for my boys. Becuse I read the reviews I found a new and faster way to shred chicken without using the stand mixer...a potato masher, why didn't I think of that? I used 3.5 lbs of fresh chicken breast, 1 cup of Franks Original, 1 package of Giant Eagle brand dry Ranch seasoning, 1 tbs of chicken bouillon and a heaping fork of jarred garlic. I mixed it in a 2 cup measuring cup then topped it off with water to make 2 cups of sauce. Next time I will cut it back to 1.5 cups total. Other thoughts from the other reviews: 1. Put this on a heavy bun like a Kaiser Roll, the cheap Hamburger buns will dissolve from the liquid. 2. If you buy the bagged from the freezer chicken they add lots of water/brine to it. This could contribute to the runny and or to salty outcome.   I plan to make this again.

text:
Easy, easy, easy, easy, easy, easy, easy, easy, and yummy! Literally you throw 4 chicken breasts, a packet of ranch dressing, and a bottle of hot sauce in a crock pot and walk away - 6 hours later you've got a fabulish dinner! Chicken wasn't dry or too spicy (you can control that depending on the hot sauce you use) and I have leftovers. This is going in the dinner rotation from now on. Even a buffoon can do this Buffalo recipe! Love, love, love!!!!!
Review:

2

2013-10-03T07:04:31.93

text:
What a disappointment! After reading some reviews, I was concerned about this being a bit too salty so I cut down the sauce quite a lot. I figured I could always add more if needed. For 4 pcs chicken, I used 8 ozs of sauce and 1/3 of ranch packet. Way too salty for me. I added sugar and that made it a bit better but still not quite. Not sure what I'm going to do with lots of leftover.

text:
Wow!  Delicious on sandwiches as well as on a pizza!  I varied a bit by cooking the chicken in broth with added RedHot.  Then shredding after 4-5 hours, reserving some liquid and adding a mixture of Red Hot and butter (how I usually make wing sauce).  I also added some of the reserved liquid to the Red Hot/Butter mixture.  Cooked another hour on low.  Came out perfect!

This is 5 stars if you used thighs instead of breasts. I've made it both ways and the former is better. Also, shred then return to crockpot for at least 30 minutes seems to really infuse the sauce. I thought this would be really spicy with so much hot sauce, but maybe the salad dressing mix mellows it a bit.

text:
great recipe especially for atkins dieters.  i just threw in 4 FROZEN whole chicken breasts to the crockpot, added 12 oz bottle of valentinos hot sauce (franks red hot would work/taste the same) - 0 carbs and 1/2 cup of blue cheese dressing - 0 carbs.  on low for 8 hours.... perfect!  shredded and stirred with just a fork then added 4 oz cream cheese and 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar.  put on pork rinds and celery :)  even my non-dieting, picky husband loved it.  SOOOOOOOO EASY!!!! thanks!

text:
Super easy. I used a bottle of wing sauce I found on sale at Target. I don't have a slow cooker so I simply do it the old fashion way - A pot on the stove on the lowest setting. It should take at least 3 hours for your meat to cook and when it shreds easily with a foor it is done! Time permitting, I like to leave my shredded meat on the stove a little while (maybe an hour) to soak up all the good marinade.

text:
Delicious!  Made some modifications due to different levels of tolerances for "hotness."  I used 3 large boneless breasts.  For the buffalo sauce I used 1/2 cup of chicken broth, 1/2 cup of Frank's buffalo hot sauce & 1/2 cup of blue cheese dressing.  I shredded the chicken after about 5 hours & let it sit cook a about an hour longer.  The chicken was delicious & left the lips tingling but not burning.  Served the chicken on nice rolls with blue cheese dressing & cole slaw.  Dripping, messy sandwich but worth the extra napkins.

text:
YUMMY!  I used the whole packet of Ranch dressing mix and only 1/2 bottle of Franks Wing Sauce.  There was a lot of liquid in my slow cooker so I tried to drain it and reduce it so I'd have a slightly thicker sauce, but my patience and my chicken couldn't wait.  It was okay though because when I shredded the chicken it sort of absorbed the extra sauce.  Next time I might add a boneless thigh or two for a little extra flavor but it was delicious just the way the recipe is written.  Served it on some toasted whole wheat buns and topped with blue cheese dressing.  Might try blue cheese slaw next time.  My 11 year old ate two whole sandwiches!  We'll definitely be having this again soon.

text:
This recipe is great. I've made it with pure chicken breast and a mixture of chicken breast and thigh. For me it worked better with just chicken breast, the mixture got way too watery from the fat in the thighs. I also stick to Frank's Original sauce because it's such a perfect Buffalo style sauce. (Not sure why they make and charge more for "Buffalo" flavor? Original is perfect.) 

I did also try to add some chopped celery to add some vegetables but of course they completely evaporated throughout the slow cooking process, I may attempt again but add them in with 30 minutes to go.

My boyfriend and I absolutely loved these sandwiches!!! I used 8 chicken breasts with 1/4 cup honey and 2 tsp minced garlic with 2 bottles franks hot buffalo sauce on the 6 hr high setting. country:
None
text:
This was so simple it was almost silly that it was a recipe! I figured it would just be "ok", but it was EXCELLENT! I used 2 thighs and 2 breasts, because that's what I had. I don't normally like thighs but they work better in the crockpot. I plopped the frozen chicken in the pot and sprinkled the ranch dressing over the top, then topped with the hot sauce. I didn't read the instructions and I put the butter in as well. When I got home, the sauce kind of separated. I shredded the chicken and then mixed it together and let the chicken soak up the sauce a little bit. We had them on kaiser rolls with bleu cheese dressing as a mayo. They were so delicious! Even warmed up the next day for lunch they were great. Really simple and easy and perfect!! Thanks!

I thought this was a good and very easy recipe.  I added Franks Hot Wing sauce, I could not find a 17.5 oz bottle of hot sauce the recipe called for so I used most of the bottle of the wing sauce that I had bought. I thought that the chicken needed some liquid as the hot sauce pretty much evaporated when it cooked in the slow cooker. I ended up adding some water to it during the last hour or so of cooking time. I would make this again, its great topped with ranch or blue cheese dressing and some cheese!

text:
Awesome! The only thing I changed was to cube the chicken in 2 inch cubes before placing in crockpot. It cooks a little faster and is WAY easier to shred! Also, to make it a little thicker and spicier, we added a packet of buffalo seasoning mix (found with the powder marinades and rubs). Great on onion rolls!

userID:
260508
Display Name:
SABRYSON
isPro:
False
followersCount:
4

0
madeRecipesCount:
20
favoritesCount:
199
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674137.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
These are awesome! I made the mistake of throwing frozen breasts into the crockpot along with the ranch and sauce. As a seasoned crockpot user, I should have known better. Shame on me! The amount of liquid in the pot was ridiculous after the chicken breasts released the water from being frozen! I simply removed the breasts and shredded them and then made up some more homemade buffalo sauce (1/2 cup hot sauce(I prefer Trappy's Red Devil),4 TBS melted butter, 1 tsp vinegar) that I then added the other half of the ranch packet to. I tossed it all in a pan and cooked on low heat for a while. We had these on toasted buns with sliced pepperjack cheese and topped them with some prepared slaw mix I tossed with blue cheese dressing. The combo of the slightly spicy meat, the pepperjack and crunchy tang of the blue cheese slaw was a great combo. Next time, I will go ahead and toss the breasts in the crockpot by themselves to cook and then shred them and toss with homemade sauce, the ranch and put back in the crock for an hour or so to simply heat through. I will certainly be making these again and will always serve with pepperjack, the blue cheese slaw and toasted buns.

text:
As a person who only likes my food to have a little bit of a kick, if any at all, these were not for me.  I bought the most mild buffalo sauce I could find and it was still entirely too spicy.  I like a splash of buffalo sauce, but a meal saturated in it is just too spicy.  I even added extra bottled ranch to try to offset the heat.  So unless you really like spicy, these aren't for you.  They definitely aren't going to go over well with the kiddos.  They have a nice taste to them, but they are just too hot even with the mildest sauce.

text:
My husband liked the taste, but not the texture.  The recipe said cook 6-7 hours, so I cooked 6 hours on low without opening the slow cooker until I shredded the chicken and added butter at 6 hours.  I did leave it cooking on low for another 45 minutes, so maybe it was my fault, but the recipe did say cook for 6-7 hours.  My husband thought it lacked texture and tasted mushy like canned chicken.  I will probably try this again because I need more slow cooker recipes, but will cook it for less time (maybe on high for 4 hours as in another chicken slow cooker recipe I like?).  I would give it 3 1/2 stars if I could.

text:
I really wanted to love this recipe since it was so easy but my family wouldn't eat it.  I followed the directions as indicated and chose Frank's Buffalo sauce. I also toasted the hoagie rolls with a slice of American cheese.  We did not like it at all.  I'm not sure the purpose of the Ranch dressing mix since I could not taste it but maybe I should have used the whole packet verses a half as indicated.  I found this to taste just like the bottle of sauce so if you can eat your favorite sauce straight out of the bottle, you will probably like this a lot.   Instead of throwing this out, I tried to make it as a dip as suggested by another reader.  I put it in a dish, sprinkled chedder cheese all over it and baked it until the cheese melted and then served with fresh celery.  Still not a winner for my family.  Sorry.

Display Name:
Sheila

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677174.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Enjoyed and it was so convenient to throw it in the crockpot and forget about it for a few hours.  Used 5 large boneless chicken breasts, entire 12 oz bottle of Frank's Red Hot sauce (did not reserve any to splash on top of the meat later when serving), and the entire 1 oz pkg of ranch dressig mix.  Added a couple of teaspoons of minced garlic and a generous drizzle of honey.   Cooked on low for 3 hours, removed the chicken and shredded it, returned it to the slower cooker with the sauce & a couple of tbs of butter and cooked for another 45 mins.    Served on hearty hoagie rolls with ranch dressing and a topping of blue cheese coleslaw (recipe on this site).

text:
MMMM! I used Louisiana brand buffalo wing sauce and it was a little salty so I will try a different kind next time. I started it before work and it was ready when I got home which was nice but it was a little runny. I added the butter then let it cook a little while longer with the top off so some of the juice would evaporate. This worked out nicely. I buttered and toasted the rolls in a frying pan and added slices of Havarti cheese. The smoky flavor and creamy texture of the melted cheese made these super yummy! Great recipe!

text:
I used frozen tenderloins and franks red hot buffalo wing sauce. As with all of these types of recipes, the outcome is as good as the sauce you use. All I could really taste was ranch flavored wing sauce. It was yummy, but overpowering. But if you spread only a little of the filling on the bread, and add ranch dressing- it is awesome!

text:
Delicious!!  My husband especially loved it, he told me if they sold this in a restaurant it would be a hit.  I used 3 chicken breasts and a 12 oz bottle of Frank's buffalo sauce and it came out perfect.  Some people have said that the sauce evaporated or that the chicken was dry, but I didn't have either of these problems using those amounts.  It made enough for two sandwiches plus two for tomorrow night, with possibly some left over.  I put provolone cheese on the rolls and melted in the oven for 5 minutes before putting on the chicken and some ranch dressing.  Yum!

country:
None
text:
My husband LOVES this, although I will say that we tried it once with Tony Roma's Buffalo sauce and then once with Frank's Wing Sauce, and the Tony Roma's one was better.  We make a large crockpot full of it and then make sandwiches, pizza, dipping sauce for chips and even put them in eggs for a breakfast burrito that is surprisingly good!  Freezes really well too.    I cook whole chicken breasts for 6-7 hours, then shred them and leave them in for another hour on low just to get them to soak up the sauce.

text:
So so easy and delicious! I used Frank's Hotsauce and the flavor was wonderful. **Some reviewers complained about the thin consistency. To thicken up the chicken mixture at the end, I mixed 1 tbsp of melted butter with 1 tbsp flour. Then I added it to the chicken, stirred it, and let it sit for 3 minutes. It's the simpliest way to thicken any gravy or soup, and it worked perfectly with this.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
easy and deeeelicious! I took advice from other posters who cut back on the sauce; I added a few ounces when I put chicken in the crockpot, added a few more half way thru cooking, and then a dash when it was served. I did not think this was too salty; moswtly likely due to less hot sauce. I would cook this for no more than 6 hours; I cooked for 7 and it was a little too long; the meat was too soft. Add more chicken breasts to the crockpot so you have leftovers, you are going to love this dish!

text:
We LOVED this! My hubby loves hot wings and I love chicken in the crockpot, so this was the best of both worlds. I didn't have a ranch packet, so I used regular ranch dressing instead. I also didn't have the buffalo sauce (they were out at the store!) so I did the proportion of regular hot sauce & butter the back of the bottle calls for. The hot sauce really mellowed out after all day in the crockpot. It was very flavorful, but not so hot that I was running for a glass of milk. I am making this again this week!

This is a great recipe for how easy this is. If you like spicy & use a lot of Franks or similar sauces, then you'll probably like this. I only had 2 breasts & seasoned the chicken breasts first with some southwest seasoning...cooked them up a bit so I could speed up the process & only cooked them for 4 hrs. They shredded really easily but I could see if you used less sauce, them being dry. We ran out of bread & used tortillas too with a little cheese. Really good!

text:
Not my thing, but bf loves buffalo chicken so occasionally I make stuff like this just for him.  This was one of those times.  I thought it was okay, a bit spicy, but nothing special.  Bf liked it, although he said it was a bit spicy.  I asked him if it was too spicy, and he said it wasn't, although he was sweating by the time he finished his second sandwich.  LOL.  I used an entire chicken, cut up, so I doubled the sauce, which was good.  I was a bit concerned while it was cooking--it looked like too much sauce, and runny at that, but when I shredded the chicken, it was perfect.  It works just as well to use a whole chicken, just be prepared to search for bones, grisle, and skin and take it out as you shred.  It took me a bit longer to do that, but I don't regret using the whole chicken.  We don't have chicken breasts at the moment, and his parents give us these huge chickens that cook best in the slow cooker.  I put it in at about 7:30 am and took it out at 4:30 pm, so it was in there a good amount of time. Bf insisted the sandwiches HAD to have ranch dressing on them, so I served with that as well. Thanks for the recipe!

text:
I used 3 large chicken breasts in my 3.5 qt cooker.  I added about 6oz Franks Red Hot Buffalo Wing sauce, 1/2 pkt of the ranch seasoning & after mixing, placed a thin slice of butter on each breast. Cooked on high 1.5hrs, shredded the chicken, added a bit more sauce & continued on high for 1/2hr.  Toasted & buttered our rolls & served w/Briannas Blue Cheese Dressing.  We loved it!  I rinsed off some chicken for my little guy - too hot for him. Def would make again.

Our 7 and 4 yr old thought it was so spicy they begged me for a big glass of milk. It was a tremendous amount of wasted sauce and the chicken was swimming in it.

text:
This is a delicious recipe.  After being in the slow cooker for a few hours, the chicken was tender and very easy to shred.  After I shredded it, I put it back into the slow cooker for another two hours, and the result was tender, juicy chicken.  I didn't have dry ranch salad dressing mix on hand, so I added a bit of actual ranch dressing instead. I highly recommend this recipe.  It's so simple to make, yet so delicious.

I used 4 chicken breasts and about half a bottle of Franks Buffalo Wing sauce. After about 7 hours (I was away most of the day) the sauce had separated and while the chicken was cooked, the sauce hadn't penetrated and the chicken was almost plain. I shredded it and mixed it with most of the remaining sauce from the bottle. It's not bad, but I think it may be better to just cook the chicken plain and mix in the sauce after. I couldn't tell anything from the ranch dressing, so not sure if it's needed. Not sure if I will make again.

I've made this recipe about 4 times in the past two months...My husband, family, friends and I all LOVE it!!!  The only thing I did different was omit the butter,  I use Frank's Buffalo Sauce and to me it tastes buttery enough.  We've also learned that chicken tenders are way easier to shred than chicken breast.  We like to serve ours on rolls w/ jalapenos, ranch dressing, and pepper jack cheese. MMMmmmmmm!!! I'm still amazed that you can put 3 ingredients in a crock pot and it turns out this YUMMY!!!

text:
This recipe is amazing if you are a buffalo chicken lover. I have made this several times and have found that using the dry ranch dressing is key to this recipe, I always add a full packet too, it helps take so the vinegar flavor isn't so overwhelming. I use franks buffalo wing sauce and I haven't added the butter yet. I serve these on Kieser buns with tomato, sliced cucumber, onion, cheese and ranch dressing. The leftover's reheat really well too!

Been waiting to try this cause all the reviews were so good.   I gotta say I think it was just ok...It needs a little more seasoning...Probably needs blue cheese chunks and liquid ranch dressing in addition to the ranch packet.  I used the hoagie rolls...toasted them, then topped with meat and cheese...and put back on oven for a few to melt the cheese.  I also used texas pete, and entire 13 oz bottle for 3 chicken breasts.  I used all the sauce in the recipe with only half the meat and I still felt it could have used more sauce, especially after I shredded it.  All in all its a good quick and easy to make recipe and I would make it again

userID:
3921382
Display Name:
Laura
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674153.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was AMAZING and a new football favorite/must have!  I made this with 3 lbs of chicken breasts, used one 23 oz. jar of Franks Hot Sauce and a little over half of a 12 oz bottle (after reading other reviews used this instead of Franks Wing Sauce to cut back on the salt) and a packet and a half of ranch dresssing.  We were afraid it would be too spicy, but the ranch and butter really tone down the heat.  After reading other reviews I took it out after 6 hours, shredded the chicken then put it back in for the next 2 hours.  Also added the butter when I shredded the chicken.  Putting the shredded chicken back in the sauce made a huge difference: it soaked up the sauce and was much more flavorful.  Served on grilled hoagie and kaiser rolls with choice of cheese, slaw, extra hot sauce and ranch dressing.  The leftovers were really good as well: made another sandwich the next day for lunch and am going to make buffalo chicken pizza with the remaining.

text:
OMGooooodness was this good!  I used fresh unfrozen chicken breasts right after I bought them.  I ended up using Kroger's mild sauce (12 oz only) since that was the only mild brand available.  Used an entire packet of the ranch dressing.  I shredded the chicken after 5 hours, added the butter and let it sit in the pot for another  hour.  That's all.  The level of spiciness was perfect, it was not runny at all, and the amount of sauce was plenty.  I also put a leaf of lettuce and provolone cheese when I made the sandwiches.  Everyone LOVED them.  Woohoo!!

None
country:
None
text:
This was great!  I made a few small modifications, but not much.  I used precooked frozen breasts so I used about 5 of them because they were so small.  I used 3/4 of a 12oz bottle of hot buffalo sauce.  The butter was added at the beginning instead of the end, and I shredded the chicken about 5 hours in so the meat would soak up more of the sauce.    It was fairly spicy, but good!  The sauce was not soupy as I used less and let it soak into the meet.  My husband gave it a thumbs up!  Next time, I am going to add blue cheese crumbles to the sandwich :)

text:
OMG good!!  Just made for the first time and it was great.  I used Moore's medium Buffalo Wing Sauce, poured 3/4 of a 16 oz jar over the frozen chicken breast, shredded chicken when I got home from work and added about 4 to 5 tablespoons of  my homemade ranch dressing.  When ready to eat, toasted buns, and topped buffalo chicken with blue cheese dressing, wonderful, all the great buffalo chicken flavor without the breading and deep frying.  I recommend highly.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
WOW!!!! I never thought I could make something SO tasty and EASY!      I used the following and it turned out absoloutly amazing and I thought that the dry ranch seasoning really evened out the spicyness of the Buffalo sauce I used!    I used five chicken breasts cut in half and put in my slow cooker. For the Buffalo sauce I used "Lowrys" brand, I bought 3 bottles of it and used two and a WHOLE packet of hidden valley ranch seasoning, mixed it all up cooked in my crockpot for about 5 hours, shredded cooked for another half hour (the key is NOT to cook to long, the juices will soak in overnight in the fridge)    I started this around 5-6PM and stopped cooking it around 10 then put right in the fridge, packed some for my fiances lunch and he called me raving!   With the amount of sauce I used initially I didnt need to add anymore sauce afterwards :-)

text:
Altered this one a bit.  Used fresh chicken breast(6)which cut down the cooking time (2 1/2 hours on high and an hour on low) and used a new Franks Red Hot Wings sauce (Sweet Heat BBQ).  Instead of regular ranch, I used Hidden Valley's Fiesta Ranch.  Omitted the butter at the end and it turned out excellent.  The Sweet Heat BBQ sauce has some bite, but not as much as the regular Buffalo Wing sauce.  The Fiesta Ranch added a slight Southwestern taste to the sauce.  Will certainly make again and look forward to making this recipe as listed above.

text:
Awesome recipe!  Mine came out pretty spicy, but that all depends on the type of buffalo sauce you use.  After 6 hours of cooking, I took the chicken out and shredded it with 2 forks, then put it back in the slow cooker and cooked for another hour.  Amazingly tender. I served it with lettuce and ranch dressing to cool it down a little!

text:
Oh happy day - I've found something that will satisfy my lust for wings! We had a cookout tonight for friends and I opted to try this out on them - lots of compliments and recipe requests (esp when I mentioned the sugg'n of using it for tailgates!) I used a 2.5 lb bag of frozen breasts, 1 bottle mild sauce, majority of another bottle of hot. Omitted butter, shredded and added more sauce for the last hour, to make sure it stayed moist/saucy. Some folks used a bun, some simply ate it by itself, perhaps with a dash of blue cheese or ranch on top. Went great with Cheesy Ranch Potato Bake from this site - thanks for the submission!

text:
1-The chicken is GREAT.  2-I don't care for Frank's Buffalo sauce...they add paprika, and it's too sweet for my tastes. So, if you want authentic Buffalo sauce, I recommend adding butter to Frank's original, OR, you can just use your fave type of buffalo sauce! 3-the sandwich...not for me and my husband. We tried eating it with the rolls, and didn't like it at all, SO, since then I serve it like a a burrito, with mexican rice, sour cream, etc. and we love it like that. 4-the chicken is great, super easy and delicious....so...make it and serve it however you like!! :) 5-we used leftovers to make buffalo chicken pizza like many other reviewers...also delicious! :)

text:
Great recipe!  My husband and I really liked it.  Make enough for leftovers - it's better the next day!!  I made the following modifications: 1. 1/2 packet of ranch salad dressing 2. Used Texas Pete Buffalo Wing Sauce 3. 1 lb. chicken breast, 1 lb thighs 4. Added 1 cup chicken stock - will omit next time because the sauce was still too thin after 4 hours and had to thicken with cornstarch.  I did not have to add the rest of the bottle. 5. Shredded chicken after 3 hours on low, it was already cooked through.   Cooked on low for another 45 mins or so.  My crockpot runs hot even on low. 6. Served melted cheddar cheese on huge crusty rolls with carrots and ranch dressing for dipping.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614262.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Excellent recipe. Very adaptable to make to individual tastes. Our family likes hot and spicy foods. Here are the changes I made:  Ingredients changes: 6 chicken breasts 1 12 oz bottle regular wing sauce 1 12 bottle hot wing sauce 1-oz package dry ranch mix  Pour in half of the regular wing sauce and half of the hot wing sauce with half pkg. ranch mix. Cooked 6 hours. Removed chicken and shredded. Strained the sauce from crockpot into a bowl - reserved this sauce for later.  Into the crockpot add remaining of the regular wing sauce and remaining dry ranch mix, add butter and stir to blend. Return shredded chicken to crockpot stir to blend. If needed add reserved sauce to the shredded chicken to moistened.  Initially, this dish was very spicy as we like, but after a few hours it mellowed out significantly - very mild the next day- still very delicious. Husband loved it but missed the crunch of wings- will crisp the  rolls next time.

Wonderful recipe!I had to make a few changes according to what I had on hand. I used 8 bone-in, skin-on chicken breast,baked with ranch mix and hot sauce(Franks). text:
This is a very tasty recipe. I couldn't find Frank's wing sauce so I used another brand. To avoid the dry and overcooked syndrome, I used bone in split breasts as I always do. I take the skin off (literally a three minute process) before cooking. Just peel it and cut it off. I cooked on high for 4 hours, shredded it, then returned it to the sauce for an hour on low, when I added the butter. Perfecto! served it with jack cheese and blue cheese salad dressing.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614284.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
To enlighten The Alchemist about the Buffalo in Buffalo wings.  They originated in the Anchor Bar in Buffalo, NY (been there, ate there, loved it). Their fiery sauce is made on site, but there are many good bottled types available.  They're served with a side of celery and blue cheese dressing to cool your mouth in between bites of the spicy sauced wings (no, the dressing is not for dipping the wings).  Since original wings are deep fat fried, then tossed in butter, then the sauce, this recipe is a very healthy alternative.

text:
This recipe is a keeper.  It was very easy and good.  My batch was a little salty as others commented, but I didn't notice that until after I added the butter.  Maybe try unsalted butter if you have it.  I wouldn't skip the butter because, despite the saltiness, it did improve the flavor and made it seem more like wings.

I'm giving this four stars because I loved it and my husband hated it (even though we're both huge hot wing fans).  I thought this had a great taste and the chicken was very moist, plus it was so simple!  Our chicken was done in only 5 hours.  We used half the packet of ranch mix so it wouldn't get too salty and I served on hoagie rolls with blue cheese dressing.  Loved it!

text:
I Doubled the recipe and served the sandwiches with bleu cheese dressing.  I used to make sandwich similar to this only I didn't make it in a slow cooker or shred them.  This version is much easier. The best part was throwing the chicken in frozen.  No need to defrost the breasts.  I used a 3lb package which gave me 8 breasts. Thanks
Made this again recently.  With the leftover I used it to make Buffalo Chicken Dip from this recipe.
Thanks again for the recipe !

region:
None
country:
None
text:
These had good flavor and were really low maintenance.  Perfect for those busy days when you don't have time to cook.  I just threw the ingredients together in the morning and let it go.  When we got home the house smelled great and all I had to do was shred the chicken.  The kids liked these too.  I only used about 1/2 bottle of sauce for fear it would be too spicy for them.  My husband and I just added extra sauce to ours to kick it up a notch.  My husband was a little weirded out about the shredded chicken because he usually have buffalo chicken sandwiches with a whole chicken breast.  He still really enjoyed these and liked the change from the regular stuff. Thanks for the recipe!

text:
I'm a big fan of buffalo wings, this is a good idea, but it's just not the same.  I missed the crunchiness of the fried chicken, the darker meat with the skin and fat with the buffalo sauce all over it, using breast meat was a little odd.  Must watch this closely so you do not over cook the chicken.  I'm sure this works great for some people, just wasn't for me.
